ethnologue_comment.comment:
Salumá [slj] is listed in E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26 as a separate Cariban language,
but the only two wordlists pertaining to a Cariban language with this name in the stated area is clearly Trio [tri]
(**hh:g:Carlin:Trio**:8). If Salumá is to be understood to refer to the group **hh:hv:Frikel:Nord-Para** calls Charúma, then their language is that in the Waiwai [waw] entry. Either way, no separate Cariban language Salumá [slj] can be asserted. See also: Trió [tri], Waiwai [waw].
